body.p:
I thought perhaps you would like to get a note from me so I have come down to the Store to write to you. Father has been to the city to daytoday and came home sick with the head-ache, so sick he had to go to beadbed, the rest of the family are all well I believe I am getting fat myself you won't know me hardly when you see
me, evry oneeveryone who sees me tells me that I look so much better and what is more I feel better than I have since I left the farm. Walt I want to see you badly, I don't know weatherwhether I will get to come down Saturday or no, but if I don't get down Saturday I will come down Saturday week, for certain. I was down to see H. Stafford to daytoday, he wants to get in J Seca's office for the winter if he can and if H he does it will be good for me, he is well and, at present working
on the farm. H.G. is down yet, he will be down for several days by the way he talks him and our folks get along well. Mother thinks him tip top, and it makes her mad if I say anything against him she toledtold me the other day if I did not want to sleep with him I could go somewharesomewhere else for she was not going to keep a bed for me by myself. You will please excuse bad writing and other mistakes
for the store is full of men blowing and looking at me and I have to get along the best way I can I will have to stop writing now so good bye for here is G. Tomlinson and I will have to stop

closer.salute: Ever your trutrue and loving friend
